document.docAuthor: Tedrow, Riley, Nathan, Kabanguka, Richard, Nasasira & Svenson, Gavin J.
document.masterDocTitle: A survey of the praying mantises of Rwanda, including new records (Insecta, Mantodea)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A survey of the praying mantises of Rwanda, including new records (Insecta, Mantodea)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Hoplocorypha lacualis Giglio-Tos, 1916
(
Figs 3
A, 15 C–D)
Sampling. ANP. 1 —Two males ( GSMC 004711– 12 ) and one nymph ( GSMC 004386). ANP. 2 —One female ( GSMC 004605).

Distribution. Species within the genus
Hoplocorypha
range across the African continent as well as Madagascar .
Hoplocorypha lacualis
is previously recorded in Congo , Kenya , Somalia , and Tanzania , but is new to Rwanda .
Comments. The keys used for this genus are ambiguous and require both male and female specimens for proper identification. Revisionary work is needed.

TABLE 1. Number of genera, species, and specimens sampled on each of the four surveyed localities across Rwanda. Abbreviations: ANP—Akagera National Park; ADR—Arboretum de Ruhande, National University of Rwanda; NNP— Nyungwe National Park; VNP—Volcanoes National Park.

TABLE 2. Sampled adult specimens by species including locality, number of specimens, and recorded status in Rwanda. Taxa newly recorded in Rwanda are marked with (*), genera and species newly recorded in Rwanda are marked with (**).
